ala: no, not, zero; [~ ala ~] (used to form a yes-no question); nothing
alasa: to hunt, forage, seek | ALT (pv.) try to, attempt
ale, ali: all; abundant, countless, bountiful, every, plentiful; abundance, everything, life, universe; one hundred | ALT {obsolete} 20, 120 {see mute}
anpa: bottom, lower part, under, below, floor, beneath; low, lower, bottom, down; {pu} bowing down, downward, humble, lowly, dependent
awen: enduring, kept, protected, safe, waiting, staying; (pv.) to continue to, to keep
en: (between multiple subjects) | ALT (coordinates modifiers in a pi-phrase or objects of a prepostion)
esun: market, shop, fair, bazaar, business transaction
ete: beyond, exceeding, outside of, more than
ewe: stone, gravel, rock, pebble, lava, magma
ike: bad, negative; non-essential, irrelevant | ALT complicated, complex
insa: centre, content, inside, between; internal organ, stomach
isipin: to think, brainstorm, rationalize, conclude, ponder
jaki: disgusting, obscene, sickly, toxic, unclean, unsanitary
jami: eliciting or stimulating a positive sensory  experience {see suwi}
jasima: reflect, resound, mirror, be on the opposite/polar end of
jo: to have, carry, contain, hold {see lon, poki, lanpan}
kalama: to produce a sound; recite, utter aloud
kama: arriving, coming, future, summoned; (pv.) to become, manage to, succeed in
ken: to be able to, be allowed to, can, may; possible
kepeken: to use, with, by means of
kijetesantakalu: any animal from the Procyonidae family, such as raccoons, coatis, kinkajous, olingos, ringtails and cacomistles; any animal from the Musteloidea superfamily, including raccoons, weasels, otters, skunks, and red pandas.
kin: indeed, too, also, as well {see a}
ko: clay, clinging form, dough, semi-solid, paste, powder
kokosila: to speak a non-Toki Pona language in an environment where Toki Pona is more appropriate
kon: air, breath; essence, spirit; hidden reality, unseen agent
ku: interact with the Toki Pona Dictionary {see pu}
kule: colorful, pigmented, painted | ALT of or relating to the LGBT+ community
kulijo: [interjection] casual expression of appreciation or acknowledgement; cool, fine, okay
kulupu: community, company, group, nation, society, tribe
kute: ear; to hear, listen; pay attention to, obey
la: (between the context phrase and the main sentence)
lanpan: take, seize, catch, receive, get {see jo, alasa}
lawa: head, mind; to control, direct, guide, lead, own, plan, regulate, rule
len: cloth, clothing, fabric, textile; cover, layer of privacy
li: (between any subject except mi alone or sina alone and its verb; also to introduce a new verb for the same subject)
lili: little, small, short; few; a bit; young
linja: long and flexible thing; cord, hair, rope, thread, yarn | ALT line, connection
lipu: flat object; book, document, card, paper, record, website
lon: located at, present at, real, true, existing | ALT (affirmative response)
luka: arm, hand, tactile organ; five | ALT touch/feel physically, interact, press
lukin: eye {see oko}; look at, see, examine, observe, read, watch; look for, seek; (pv.) try to {see alasa}
ma: earth, land; outdoors, world; country, territory; soil
mama: parent, ancestor; creator, originator; caretaker, sustainer
mani: money, cash, savings, wealth; large domesticated animal
meli: woman, female, feminine person; wife {see mije, tonsi}
mije: man, male, masculine person; husband {see meli, tonsi}
misa: Glires or Eulipotyphla; rat, mouse, squirrel, rabbit, rodent; {~ suli} capybara
moku: to eat, drink, consume, swallow, ingest
mun: moon, night sky object, star | ALT glow, glowing light, light in the dark {see suno}
mute: many, a lot, more, much, several, very; quantity; three or more; 20
n: [interjection] indicating thinking, pondering, recognition, agreement; hum, humming
nasin: way, custom, doctrine, method, path, road
natu: intersection, overlap, to cross a threshold, correlation, junction
nena: bump, button, hill, mountain, nose, protuberance
noka: foot, leg, organ of locomotion; bottom, lower part {see anpa} | ALT ten; twenty; negate five
o: hey! O! (vocative, imperative, or optative) {see li}
oko: {see lukin} | ALT eye, ocular, visual {cf. lukin}
olin: love, have compassion for, respect, show affection to
omekapo: goodbye, farewell, see you later, eat a good fish
pakala: botched, broken, damaged, harmed, messed up | ALT (curse expletive, e.g. fuck!)
pali: do, take action on, work on; build, make, prepare
palisa: long hard thing; branch, rod, stick
pan: cereal, grain; barley, corn, oat, rice, wheat; bread, pasta
pana: give, send, emit, provide, put, release
pi: of (used to divide a second noun group that describes a first noun group) | ALT (introduces a genitive noun)
pilin: heart (physical or emotional); feeling (an emotion, a direct experience)
pini: ago, completed, ended, finished, past {see pake}
poka: hip, side; next to, nearby, vicinity | ALT along with (comitative), beside {see kan}
poki: container, bag, bowl, box, cup, cupboard, drawer, vessel
pona: good, positive, useful; friendly, peaceful; simple
powe: unreal, false, untrue, pretend, deceive, trickster
pu: interacting with the official Toki Pona book {see ku}
puwa: fluffy, soft, squishy (something that can be compressed and will try to go back to its original shape)
sama: same, similar; each other; sibling, peer, fellow {see pata}; as, like
san: three {particularly in senary base; see tuli}
seli: fire; cooking element, chemical reaction, heat source
selo: outer form, outer layer; bark, peel, shell, skin; boundary
sewi: area above, highest part, something elevated; awe-inspiring, divine, sacred, supernatural
sijelo: body (of person or animal), physical state, torso
sike: round or circular thing; ball, circle, cycle, sphere, wheel; of one year
sin: new, fresh; additional, another, extra {see namako}
sitelen: image, picture, representation, symbol, mark, writing
sona: know, be skilled in, be wise about, have information on; (pv.) know how to
su: [yes/no question marker, taking the place of li & o] {see ala}
suli: big, heavy, large, long, tall; important; adult
suno: sun; light, brightness, glow {see mun}, radiance, shine; light source
supa: horizontal surface, thing to put or rest something on
taki: sticky, magnetic; bond, attract, attach, clip
tan: by, from, because of; origin, cause
tawa: going to, toward; for; from the perspective of; moving | ALT (pv.) going to
telo: water, liquid, fluid, wet substance; beverages
tenpo: time, duration, moment, occasion, period, situation {see waleja}
toki: communicate, say, speak, talk, use language, think; hello
tomo: indoor space; building, home, house, room
tonsi: non-binary, gender-non-conforming {see meli, mije, kule} | ALT trans, non-cisgender
utala: battle, challenge, compete against, struggle against
waleja: context, topic, salience, pertinent, topical, pertain(ing) to, about, be relevant {see tenpo}
wawa: strong, powerful; confident, sure; energetic, intense
wekama: leave and come back, be temporarily absent with the expectation of returning
wile: must, need, require, should, want, wish
yupekosi: To change a creative work and unintentionally make it worse, nobody knows how to pronounce the y.
